title: Quiz 7: Barriers & Ethics in Counselling
description: Test your knowledge on what hinders counselling and the ethical standards required.

questions.question: What is the barrier known as 'Parroting'?

options.text: Repeating the same phrases regardless of the question

questions.explanation: Parroting is when a patient (or counselor) repeats the same response/phrase continuously, blocking progress.

questions.question: Which of the following are physical barriers to counselling? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Lack of privacy in the room

questions.explanation: Privacy, noise, and appearance are physical. Language is a communication/semantic barrier.
questions.hint: Things you can see, hear, or touch in the environment.

questions.question: Match the Patient Right to its description:

pairs.right: Told the whole truth about health status

questions.explanation: Rights ensure the patient is respected, involved, and protected.
questions.hint: Match the concept to the action.

questions.question: It is ethical for a counselor to enter into a business relationship with a current patient.
questions.explanation: Counselors must avoid dual relationships (business, sexual, friendship) to prevent exploitation and loss of objectivity.

questions.question: If a counselor's ability is impaired by personal emotional difficulties, they should:

options.text: Stop offering services and refer the patient
Discuss their problems with the patient

questions.explanation: Counselors must work within limits of competence. Impairment requires stepping back.

questions.question: The patient has the right of ___BLANK___ if they feel the counselling services are incompetent.
questions.explanation: The Right of Refusal allows patients to decline services.

questions.question: Which counselor behavior is a barrier defined as 'Directing interaction into areas of self-interest rather than the patient's lead'?
questions.explanation: Changing topics prevents the patient from exploring what matters to them.

questions.question: Terms of counselling should include which of the following? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Terms cover logistics and rules, but a counselor cannot guarantee a cure/solution.

questions.question: What type of barrier exists if a counselor is young enough to be the patient's child?
questions.explanation: Age difference is a social/cultural barrier that may affect respect or openness.

questions.question: A counselor should give advice to the patient on what they think should be done.
questions.explanation: Counseling is NOT giving advice. It is helping the patient find their own solution.
